title: Who is the most voted for president in history? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Ronald Reagan received 525 electoral votes in 1984. This was 2 more than Franklin D. Roosevelt received in 1936, but there were 7 more electors in Reagan’s election. Barack Obama received 69,419,516 popular votes in 2008, the highest single-election total. He also received 65,915,795 in 2012, for a total of 135,335,311 in both his presidential races. This was more than the 103,496,774 votes FDR received in his four elections, or the 113,060,650 that Richard M. Nixon received in his two wins and one loss.

President Reagan. In his re-election campaign of 1984, against former Vice President, Walter Mondale, Reagan carried 49 states, except the state of Minnesota, where Mondale was born How is that for loop sidedness
